lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD -- It was April 2003, and American tanks had just punched through into Baghdad. A safe distance behind came the first post-invasion American bureaucracy, the Office of Reconstruction and Humanitarian Assistance (ORHA).
snippet: The electricity remains more than a complaint. It has become a key benchmark by which Iraqis judge the post-war order. And, almost universally, they adjudge it to have failed in this regard.
abstract: The electricity remains more than a complaint. It has become a key benchmark by which Iraqis judge the post-war order. And, almost universally, they adjudge it to have failed in this regard.
